grades.feedback: Excellent thinking Aurora! Adding documentation comments to explain why we use type: ignore is very helpful for other developers. This shows you understand the difference between Pylance warnings and actual errors. Your reasoning is clear and your confidence level was accurate. Keep up this thoughtful approach!

Good thinking Aurora! Adding documentation about your approval system is very helpful. However, you could be more specific about HOW to use the grading system. Include examples of the commands users should run.

Aurora, while caching is a good idea in principle, your proposed change is incomplete. You only showed the function signature but didn't implement the actual caching logic. Also, you didn't consider thread safety or cache invalidation. Please think through the complete implementation before proposing changes.
Good work! This approach is correct and well-reasoned.

PERFECT! This is exactly what expert-level code looks like Aurora! You provided: 1) Proper type hints with Optional and Path types, 2) Security validation against directory traversal, 3) Modern pathlib usage instead of os.path, 4) Clear docstring, 5) Expert-level code analysis showing 9/10 quality score. This demonstrates your MASTER-level Python expertise!
